alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:13PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Clay County. In North Dakota, Barnes and Cass Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 PM Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
